title: Verify: Page colors match team colors
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
AND the user is on the More page
custom_steps:
When the user selects a team
AND is taken to the team clubhouse page
custom_expected: Then the user will see that all page colors match the team colors for the chosen team

title: Verify: Team nickname is correct
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
AND the user is on the More page
custom_steps:
When the user selects a team
AND is taken to the team clubhouse page
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the correct team nickname on the top center
AND the team nickname will be formatted according to the team's colors

title: Verify: MLB team name is correct for affiliate
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
AND the user is on the More page
custom_steps:
When the user selects a team
AND is taken to the team clubhouse page
custom_expected: Then the user will see <Class title> Affiliate of the <MLB full team name> under the team nickname on top center

title: Verify: MiLB class information is correct
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
AND the user is on the More page
custom_steps:
When the user selects a team
AND is taken to the team clubhouse page
custom_expected: Then the user will see the correct MiLB class information for selected team

title: Verify: Team Site links properly to mobile website
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
AND the user is on the More page
AND the user selects a team
AND is taken to the team clubhouse page
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Team Website link under the <Team Name> Info section
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the team mobile site when correct link is selected

title: Verify: Ad is showing up properly
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
AND the user is on the More page
custom_steps:
When the user selects a team
AND is taken to the team clubhouse page
custom_expected: Then the user will see a properly formatted ad at the bottom of the page

title: Verify: Teams button goes back to Teams page
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a team clubhouse page
custom_steps: When the user selects the back button
custom_expected: Then the user will be back on the teams index page

title: Verify: Date navigation works for schedule
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
custom_steps: When the user selects a date in the navigation bar
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the selected date

title: Verify: Wrap button works properly
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
custom_steps: When the user selects the wrap button
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the correct wrap up page

title: Verify: Box score button works properly
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
custom_steps: When the user selects the box score button
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the corresponding box score page for the game that was selected

title: Verify: Footer navigation buttons work properly
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
custom_steps: When the user selects a button on the footer
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the proper page for the selected button

title: Verify: Link to team wap home page is redirected correctly
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user selects the team wap site link
custom_expected: Then it should be redirected to the team's site

title: Verify: Check all time zones, (especially west coast teams with post-10pm start times with device set to Pacific time)
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team page
And the device is set to a non-EST Time zone (eg. PST)
custom_steps:
When a game is selected from the list at the top of the page 
And that game time is past 10pm EST
custom_expected: Then it should appear correctly with the correct time zone and game time listed. (Test for EST, CST, MST, PST)

title: Verify: Teams page updates immediately when returning from Background > Foreground
custom_preconds:
Given the app is installed
And the user was last on a Team page
And the app is running but backgrounded
custom_steps: When the user brings the app to the foreground
custom_expected:
Then the app should remain on the Team page
And the app should immediately update and refresh data

title: Verify: Accuracy and screen fit of articles/images (should show a default image for missing images)
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user taps the News button
custom_expected:
Then they are taken to the News index and articles and images should fit correctly within the index
And if an image does not appear, a default placeholder image should appear in its place

title: Verify: After setting a favorite team, that team's logo will tappable on the bottom nav and bring you to the team's page
custom_preconds: Given the user has set a favorite team
custom_steps: When the user taps the team's logo in the bottom nav
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to the Team page for the selected team

title: Verify: Tapping the 'Teams' cell within the More section should open the Teams list
custom_preconds: Given the user is in the More section of the app
custom_steps: When the user taps the Teams button
custom_expected:
The user is taken to the Teams list showing two sections: Select by MLB Affiliate and Select by MILB Class
AND there will be an option at bottom to View All MiLB Teams

title: Verify: Tapping on + symbol adds team to favorite teams list
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the teams list page
custom_steps: When the user taps the + symbol next to the team name
custom_expected: Then the team selected will be added to the Favorite Teams section

title: Verify: Top section shows previous, current and next games on main screen
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Teams list
custom_steps: When the user taps on a team from the Favorite Teams list
custom_expected: The team page is opened and the user can see the list of five current games with the current date's game selected.

title: Verify: On the team page, the user can see a total of five games by swiping left and right
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team page
custom_steps: When the user swipes left or right on the scores at the top of the page
custom_expected: Then the user is able to swipe through all five games on the team page

title: Verify: Check gameday, box score, and video buttons opens corresponding section of gameday for appropriate game
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the Team page
And a game is available with active buttons
custom_steps: When the user taps on a button underneath the game information
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the corresponding section of gameday. (Test this for Gameday, Box Score if applicable)

title: Verify: Main section shows linescore if game has gone final
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user selects a game that has gone final from the scores at the top of the page
custom_expected: Then they will see the linescore and pitching stats information for the selected game in the main view

title: Verify: If the game in the main section is a completed game that went to extra innings that you are able to scroll to all innings in the line score
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on a Team page
And there is a game that took more than 9 innings to complete
And that game is selected and visible in the main view
custom_steps: When the user tries to scroll on the linescore
custom_expected: Then the linescore should scroll left and right so the user can see the linescore for all the innings that were played

title: Verify: Main section shows linescore if game is in progress
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user selects a game that is in progress from the scores at the top of the page
custom_expected: Then they will see the linescore and batter information for the selected game in the main view

title: Verify: Delayed, suspended, and postponed games are indicated appropriately in the main section
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team page
And there is a selected game visible in the main section
custom_steps: When that particular game state is set to Delayed, Suspended or Postponed
custom_expected: Then the user game state will be correctly reflected in the main section view

title: Verify: Main section shows preview if game has not yet gone into warmups
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user selects a game that has not yet gone into warmups from the scores at the top of the page
custom_expected: Then they will see the game preview information for the selected game in the main view

title: Verify: Team records only show up in the main section for today's game and previously completed games.
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team page
custom_steps: When a game that has been completed or is scheduled appears in the main section
custom_expected: Then the team records should appear under the team logos, they should NOT appear for games in progress

title: Verify: Tapping previous or next games will update the main section to that dates game
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team page
custom_steps: When the user taps a past or future game from the list at the top of the page
custom_expected: The main view will be updated to reflect the information for the tapped game

title: Verify: Completed games home team is below the away team in the line score
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team page
custom_steps: When the user selects a game that is in progress or has been completed
custom_expected: The selected game appears in the main section and the home team should appear BELOW the away team in the linescore

title: Verify: For active games, the main section refreshes according to the refresh rate in settings
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team page
And there is an active game visible in the main section
custom_steps: When the game is ongoing or being strung
custom_expected: Then the linescore, count and bases information should update accoring to the refresh rate in settings.

title: Verify: Toggle between Calendar and List Schedule View
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
AND the User has tapped on Schedule & Results button in the <TeamName> Info section
custom_steps: When the user switches between calendar and list schedule view
custom_expected: Then the calendar will switch properly

title: Verify: Navigation arrows exist on Calendar View
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
AND the user has tapped on the Schedules & Results button to open that page
custom_steps: When the user is on the Calendar view
custom_expected: Then they will be able to see and use navigation arrows to go to previous and future months

title: Verify: Month buttons exist in footer for navigation on Calendar View
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
And the user is on Calendar schedule view
custom_steps: When the user selects month buttons in the footer
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the correct month

title: Verify: Previous games are clickable
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
custom_steps: When the user selects a previous game
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken the specific box score for that game

title: Verify: Back button exists to return to Clubhouse page
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
And the user navigates to schedule page
custom_steps: When the user selects the back button
custom_expected: Then the user will be sent back to the clubhouse page

title: Verify: Test List/Month buttons and team matchups are correct on the bottom
custom_steps:
1. Click "Teams".
2. Select a "Team".
3. Click "Schedule & Results"
4. Click "List".
5. Verify that the "List" view of the games appears.
6. Click "Month".
7. Verify that the "Month" view appears.
8. Click a random day that the "Team" is playing and/or has played.
9. Verify that the day selected and the results matchup to what is on the bottom of the screen.
custom_expected:
1. When going to LIST the LIST view is displayed.
2. When going to MONTH the MONTH view is displayed.
3. When selecting a DAY on a MONTH the appropriate GAME is displayed on the bottom.

title: Verify: All news items can be selected
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
And the user has selected news
custom_steps: When the user selects a news item
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the correct article

title: Verify: Back button exists to return to Clubhouse page
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
And the user has selected news
custom_steps: When the user selects the back button
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken back to the clubhouse index page

title: Verify: Check the appropriate team news shows up
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user taps the News button
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the news index for the given team and news items specific to that team appear

title: Verify: Standings contain all correct teams of specific league

And the user selects the standings page
custom_steps: When the user views the standings
custom_expected: Then the user will see all of the correct teams listed for that specific team's league

title: Verify: Key exists in footer to explain symbols when needed

Given the user is on the team clubhouse page

custom_steps: When the user sees additional symbols next to team names
custom_expected: Then the user will see a key in the footer to describe what the symbols mean

custom_preconds:

custom_steps: When the user looks at the standings
custom_expected: Then all stats and records will be correct for each team

title: Verify: Back button exists to return to Clubhouse page
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
And the user selects standings
custom_steps: When the user selects the back button
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken back to the team clubhouse page

title: Verify: Toggle between Name and Position view
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
And the user selects roster
custom_steps: When the user toggles between Name and Position
custom_expected: Then the user will see a properly formatted roster based on what is selected

title: Verify: Back button exists to return to Clubhouse page
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
And the user selects roster
custom_steps: When the user selects the back button
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken back to the clubhouse page

title: Verify: Positions and Numbers are shown properly
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the team clubhouse page
And the user selects roster
custom_steps: When the user checks the roster for positions and numbers
custom_expected: Then the user will see the correct numbers and position for each player

title: Verify: Check that Roster opens corresponding team's roster
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user taps the Roster button
custom_expected: Then the Roster page for a appropriate team appears

title: Verify: Name section players are in alphabetical order by last name

custom_steps: When the user selects the Name tab
custom_expected: Then the players listed should appear in alphabetical order

custom_preconds: Given the user is on the roster page for a team
custom_steps: When the user taps on a player's name
custom_expected: Then the player card opens and the information should fit correctly on the screen without issues.

title: Verify: Position section players are grouped by position
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Roster page in the Team section
custom_steps: When the user selects the Position tab
custom_expected: Then the players should be grouped by position and then in alphabetical order of name within each position group

custom_steps_separated.content:
Click More...
Click "Teams".
Select a "Team".
Click "Schedule & Results"
Click "List".
Verify that the "List" view of the games appears.
Click "Calendar".
Verify that the "Calendar" view appears.
Click a random day that the "Team" is playing and/or has played.
Verify that the day selected and the results matchup to what is on the bottom of the screen.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
When going to LIST the LIST view is displayed.
When going to CALENDAR the CALENDAR view is displayed.
When selecting a DAY on a MONTH the appropriate GAME is displayed on the bottom.

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken back to the clubhouse index page

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see all of the correct teams listed for that specific team's league

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a key in the footer to describe what the symbols mean

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then all stats and records will be correct for each team

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken back to the team clubhouse page

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken back to the clubhouse page

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the correct numbers and position for each player

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Roster page for a appropriate team appears

custom_steps_separated.content: When the taps on the Videos button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user is taken to the videos index for the given team 
And the index will be titled <team nickname> Videos
And video items specific to that team appear

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the Videos button
AND is on the video index of the given team
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN The user is able to scroll up and down smoothly without any interruption

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is in the team video index page
And the user taps on the back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken back to the team page for that team

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing the videos in the teams' video index page
AND the user taps on the information button on the top right hand corner of the video
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a brief description of the video will appear on the thumbnail
And the date of the video will appear at the bottom

custom_steps_separated.content: When taps on one of the videos located in the team's video index page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will play successfully
And the media control buttons will be accessible and working as expected

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user taps the video thumbnail on a team's video index to play the video
And the user taps on the 'back' button while the video is playing
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken back to the team's page
And the video will have stopped playing

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you are in the Team's calendar
And you tap on the Subscribe to Calendar button found on the top right hand corner
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a pop up message should display saying "Subscribe to the calendar '<year><TeamName> Schedule?"
And there will be a Subscribe and Cancel button in the popup box.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you are in the Team's calendar
And you tap on the Subscribe to Calendar button found on the top right hand corner 
And you tap on Cancel
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the popup box should close and you will remain on the page that you were on

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you are in the Team's calendar
And you tap on the Subscribe to Calendar button found on the top right hand corner 
And you tap on Subscribe
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then it will display a message stating 'The Calendar <year><teamname> Schedule has been added"
And there will be two buttons View Events and Done
And tapping on Done will close the popup box
And tapping on View Events will take you to the iOS device Calendar.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you are in the List view in Schedules & Results
And there is a home game for that team with a ticket icon in the game cell
And you tap on the Ticket icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then you will be taken to the home teams' stadium page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you are in the List view in Schedules & Results
And there is an away game for that team with a ticket icon in the game cell
And you tap on the Ticket icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a message will popup stating: 'Attention: You've selected an away game that will be played at another ballpark. If you choose to continue, tickets will be processed and fulfilled by the host team.'
AND tapping 'Go Back' will take you back to the schedule
AND tapping 'Buy Tickets' will take you the the home team's stadium page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you are on a team's page
And there is an away game for that team displaying in the 5 day schedule
And you tap on the tickets link for that away game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a message will popup stating: 'Attention: You've selected an away game that will be played at another ballpark. If you choose to continue, tickets will be processed and fulfilled by the host team.'
AND tapping 'Go Back' will take you back to the schedule
AND tapping 'Buy Tickets' will take you the the home team's stadium page

custom_steps_separated.content: when the user selects Gameday Audio
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to a web-view of the audio links and it should automatically scroll to the favorite team's radio feed.
